question.word: Do you disagree with how a school, college or council is providing for your child's special educational needs or learning difficulties?
question.hint: (Or your own special educational needs/learning difficulties.)

question.word: Do you think the school, college or council has treated you or your child unfairly due to your:
question.hint:
• sex
  • race
  • disability
  • religion or beliefs
  • sexual orientation
  • being pregnant or having a child
question.word_done: Do you think the school, college or council has treated you or your child unfairly?

question.word: Do you want to challenge the way the school, college or council made a decision about your child's education?
question.hint: (Or a decision about your own education.)

finance.word: Are you or your partner (husband, wife, civil partner or a partner you live with) on any of these benefits?:
finance.hint:
• Income Support
  • Jobseeker's Allowance (income-based)
  • Employment and Support Allowance (income-based)
  • Pension Credit - Guarantee Credit
  • Universal Credit
finance.word_done: Are you or your partner on certain benefits?

finance.word: Do you and your partner have a combined income of more than £2,657 a month before tax?
finance.hint: (If you have more than 4 children, add £222 to the figure above for the 5th and each additional child.)

finance.word: Are you or your partner 60 or over?
Do you and your partner have more than £8,000 in savings, shares, investments or property?
finance.hint: If you own your home, include any equity you have over £100,000.
